title: K-Poincaré group
summary: In physics and mathematics, the κ-Poincaré group, named after Henri Poincaré, is a quantum group, obtained by deformation of the Poincaré group into a Hopf algebra. It is generated by the elements a μ {\displaystyle a^{\mu }} and Λ μ ν {\displaystyle {\Lambda ^{\mu }}_{\nu }} with the usual constraint:
